cx.corp.lacuna.core.linux

Class LinuxNativeProcessCollector

  • java.lang.Object
    • cx.corp.lacuna.core.linux.LinuxNativeProcessCollector
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    NativeProcessCollector

    public class LinuxNativeProcessCollector
extends java.lang.Object
implements NativeProcessCollector

    Process information gathering on Linux platforms revolves around the virtual /proc filesystem (see man proc(5)). To get the process description, the /proc/:pid/cmdline file is parsed. To get the owner, the owner of the /proc/:pid directory is fetched.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      LinuxNativeProcessCollector(java.nio.file.Path procRoot)
      Constructs a new LinuxNativeProcessCollector with the specified process directory path.

    • Constructor Detail

      • LinuxNativeProcessCollector

        public LinuxNativeProcessCollector(java.nio.file.Path procRoot)
        Constructs a new LinuxNativeProcessCollector with the specified process directory path. In most cases, this should be Paths.get("/proc").
        Parameters:
        procRoot - the parent folder of the processes.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if procRoot is null.

    • Method Detail

      • collect

        public NativeProcess collect(int pid)
        Description copied from interface: NativeProcessCollector
        Collects a NativeProcess model object from the provided process identifier. If a detail cannot be fetched, it will be set to the corresponding UNKNOWN_* constant.
        Specified by:
        collect in interface NativeProcessCollector
        Parameters:
        pid - The process identifier.
        Returns:
        A model with the details of the specified process.
        See Also:
        NativeProcess.UNKNOWN_DESCRIPTION, NativeProcess.UNKNOWN_OWNER
